div.p: This day the Letter annexed was returned to me.This appears to refer to 1155. You see my attention: It was not my fault that it did not find you at Brighthelmstone as you had said you will be.See 1157, where Bull explains his absence from Brighton when Pennant's letter arrived. I cannot now add more than my wish that I was young to unite in a crusade against the infidels of France.Pennant probably refers to the September Massacres of 2 September 1792, when aristocrats and priests were murdered. Heaven must leave them (not as it did David to his choice of Evils)2 Samuel 11–24 relates how David committed adultery with Uriah’s wife Bathsheba, then sought to destroy the evidence of his guilt even as far as ensuring the death of Uriah. God allowed him to make a series of mistakes, the 'choice of Evils' to which Pennant refers here. but to the united Judgements of the sword famine & pestilence. The destroying angels are now hovering over tha most detestable of countries.

postscript.p: with the same P.S.Cf. 1155, where the postscript reads 'Pray write soon'. Pray let me know how you & yrs do.
